itemDescription: English audio engineer who patented the truncated-tip sapphire stylus in 1945 for playing gramophone records

wikipedia_page.main: Marie Louise Killick (in some sources Maria, 1914–1964; nee Benson) was an English audio engineer who patented the truncated-tip sapphire stylus in 1945 for playing gramophone records. The tradename of her invention was Sapphox.
